definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: It turned our homes into funeral tents.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者把我們家園變成了喪棚。

sentences.english: However, all the figures have yet to come home braving persons.
sentences.chinese: 然而，所有的數字家園掘金者至今尚未如願以償。

sentences.english: Who is using the hard-working hands, as we have built a happy home?
sentences.chinese: 是誰用勤勞的雙手，爲我們營造一個溫馨的家園？

sentences.english: Refugees have been deprived of their homes, but they must not be deprived of their futures.
sentences.chinese: 難民的家園已被剝奪，絕不能讓他們的未來也被剝奪。

sentences.english: We think every young couple should set up a home of their own.
sentences.chinese: 我們提倡所有的小兩口都能靠自己的雙手構建家園。

sentences.english: Workers built shelters for survivors whose homes had been destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 救援人員爲那些家園被毀的倖存者蓋起了避難所。

sentences.english: The occasional Damara and Herero homesteads bear no trace of the Germanic penchant for order;
sentences.chinese: 的臨時家園絲毫不沒有留下日耳曼人的傾向。

sentences.english: Design a dream house and say it out to your friends.
sentences.chinese: 設計一個理想家園，並介紹給朋友聽。

sentences.english: That day at Panjiayuan, three sets of people were waving at me.
sentences.chinese: 那天在潘家園，三個人對我招手。

sentences.english: A new world to call XKB home.
sentences.chinese: 在一個叫做新課標家園的地方。

sentences.english: Haley Barbour said the initial focus was getting coastal residents back into their homes.
sentences.chinese: 州長黑利巴伯說，最初的重點是沿海的居民回家園。

sentences.english: Warlords built private gardens in Chinese and west styles with literatus' help.
sentences.chinese: 武人在文人的幫助之下建設有中西合璧的私家園林。

sentences.english: And the universe outside our solar system seems to abound with potential homes.
sentences.chinese: 太陽系外茫茫宇宙之中，似乎充滿了可能的生命家園。

sentences.english: Have you ever been to Suzhou? You can find over 100 private gardens from the old times in this city.
sentences.chinese: 你去過蘇州嗎？這個城市有一百多處古代的私家園林。

sentences.english: On big occasions, we like to decorate our homes in red.
sentences.chinese: 大場合，我們喜歡裝飾自己的家園，在一片紅。

sentences.english: "Vitality Home" was always in disaster area after 512.
sentences.chinese: “生命力家園”在512地震之後一直紮根在災區。

definition: to develop/to make full use of
to waken (to action)/to rouse (the masses)/to evoke (attention, recollection etc)
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to defend/to safeguard/to protect/to uphold/to maintain
